negotiator.protocol

Interface MultilateralProtocol

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AlternatingMajorityConsensusProtocol, AlternatingMultipleOffersProtocol, DefaultMultilateralProtocol, MediatorFeedbackBasedProtocol, MediatorProtocol, SimpleMediatorBasedProtocol, StackedAlternatingOffersProtocol

    public interface MultilateralProtocol
    The protocol describes if the negotiation is finished, what the agreement is, which actions can be done in the next round.

    The protocol is executed for example by the SessionManager.

    Specification

    A protocol should be used as follows.
    1. The first time, beforeSession(Session, List) should be called and all agents should receive the actions accordingly.
    2. For each round in the session:
      1. getRoundStructure(List, Session) should be called to determine the Round
      2. For each Turn in the Round :
        1. the Turn.getParty() agent should be called with the specified allowed actions.
        2. The agent returns a picked action
        3. getActionListeners(List) should be called to get a list of which agents need to hear the picked action of this agent.
      3. isFinished(Session, List) should be checked after the round is complete to see if there are other rounds . If so, repeat
    3. When a session is completely done, afterSession(Session, List) should be called
    Author:
    David Festen

    • Method Detail

      • getRoundStructure

        Round getRoundStructure(java.util.List<NegotiationParty> parties,
                        Session session)
        Get the structure of the current round. Each round, this method receives a list of all the NegotiationParty and the complete Session which can be used to diversify the round structure at some point during the session.
        Parameters:
        parties - The parties currently participating
        session - The complete session history
        Returns:
        A list of possible actions

      • beforeSession

        java.util.Map<NegotiationParty,java.util.List<Action>> beforeSession(Session session,
                                                                     java.util.List<NegotiationParty> parties)
                                                              throws NegotiationPartyTimeoutException,
                                                                     java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException,
                                                                     java.lang.InterruptedException
        Returns a list of Actions to be sent to NegotiationParty.receiveMessage(AgentID, Action) . This will get called just before the session starts. If some initialization with needs to be done by the protocol, it can be done here.
        Parameters:
        session - The upcoming Session
        parties - The NegotiationPartys that will participate in the session
        Throws:
        NegotiationPartyTimeoutException
        java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • afterSession

        void afterSession(Session session,
                  java.util.List<NegotiationParty> parties)
        This will get called just after ending the session. If the protocol needs to do some post session steps, it can be done here. Protocols should not handle NegotiationParty.negotiationEnded(Bid) as these are always called by the SessionManager.
        Parameters:
        session - The session instance that was used for the session
        parties - The parties that participated in the session

      • applyAction

        void applyAction(Action action,
                 Session session)
          throws ActionException
        Apply the action according to the protocol. All actions done by all agents come through this method. The protocol should check here if the agent's action is actually allowed and contains the proper data.
        Parameters:
        action - action to apply. The Agent ID in the action already has been checked when this is called.
        session - the current state of this session
        Throws:
        ActionException - if the proposed action is illegal according to the protocol.

      • isFinished

        boolean isFinished(Session session,
                   java.util.List<NegotiationParty> parties)
        Check if the protocol is done or still busy. If this method returns true, the SessionManager will not start a new Round after the current one. It will however finish all the turns described in the getRoundStructure(java.util.List, negotiator.session.Session) method.
        Parameters:
        session - the current state of this session
        parties - all the parties involved in the negotiation
        Returns:
        true if the protocol is finished

      • getActionListeners

        java.util.Map<NegotiationParty,java.util.List<NegotiationParty>> getActionListeners(java.util.List<NegotiationParty> parties)
        Get a map of parties that are listening to each other's response. All these listeners should be informed whenever a party takes an action. See also the default implementations DefaultMultilateralProtocol.listenToAll(List) and DefaultMultilateralProtocol.listenToNone(List)
        Parameters:
        parties - The parties involved in the current negotiation
        Returns:
        A map where the key is a NegotiationParty that is responding to a NegotiationParty.chooseAction(List) event, and the value is a list of NegotiationPartys that are listening to that key party's response.

      • getCurrentAgreement

        Bid getCurrentAgreement(Session session,
                        java.util.List<NegotiationParty> parties)
        This method should return the current agreement.

        Some protocols only have an agreement at the negotiation session, make sure that this method returns null until the end of the session in that case, because this method might be queried at intermediary steps.

        Parameters:
        session - The complete session history up to this point
        parties - The parties involved in the current negotiation
        Returns:
        The agreed upon bid or null if no agreement

      • getNumberOfAgreeingParties

        int getNumberOfAgreeingParties(Session session,
                               java.util.List<NegotiationParty> parties)
        Gets the number of parties that currently agree to the offer. For protocols that either have an agreement or not, you can set this number to 0 until an agreement is found, and then set this value to the number of parties.
        Parameters:
        session - the current state of this session
        parties - The parties currently participating
        Returns:
        the number of parties agreeing to the current agreement

      • endNegotiation

        void endNegotiation()
        Overwrites the rest of the protocol and sets the protocol state to finish

      • endNegotiation

        void endNegotiation(java.lang.String reason)
        Overwrites the rest of the protocol and sets the protocol state to finish
        Parameters:
        reason - Optionally give a reason why the protocol is finished.
